description.narrative: The Project intends to promote a more strategic, inclusive, responsive and sustainable implementation of the national criminal justice reform agenda, funded by INL

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1 # of criminal justice sector gender-responsive strategies, plans and actions, which are informed by available evidence, increased coordination in the sector and inclusive public consultation
1.2 # of internal technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert Working Group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) on justice sector reform 1.3 # of technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) with Development Partners on justice sector reform 1.4 # of amended laws, regulations and by-laws developed and adopted by Parliament and/or Government for legal harmonization and/or implementation 1.5 # of monitoring activities conducted by Expert Working Group and coordination mechanisms 2.1 # database developed 2.2 # TOT for training Centers
2.3 of manuals and/or guidelines developed on fair trial standards 2.4 % of prosecutors trained who state an increased understanding after the training, including on fair trial standards and due process of law
2.5 % of observed trials conducted in compliance with novelties of criminal justice sector reform 2.6 # of prosecutors trained on new laws and codes

comment.narrative: Draft annual workplan 2019 developed 2 internal technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert Working Group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) on justice sector reform 2 technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) with Development Partners on justice sector reform 5 regulations approved 2 monitoring activities conducted by Expert Working Group and coordination mechanisms 0 database developed for GPO Training Center 0 TOT for GPO training Center held 0 manuals and/or guidelines developed on fair trial standards 0 % of prosecutors trained who state an increased understanding after the training, including on fair trial standards and due process of law 0 % of observed trials conducted in compliance with novelties of criminal justice sector reform 700 out of 840 of prosecutors trained on new laws and codes

-Annual workplan 2020 and 2021 developed 9 internal technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert Working Group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) on justice sector reform 3 technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) with Development Partners on justice sector reform Regulations approved depending on identified needs 4 monitoring activities conducted by Expert Working Group and coordination mechanisms 1 database developed for GPO Training Center 1 TOT for GPO training Center held 1 manual and/or guidelines developed on fair trial standards At least 80% of prosecutors trained who state an increased understanding after the training, including on fair trial standards and due process of law 20%of observed trials conducted in compliance with novelties of criminal justice sector reform prosecutors trained on new laws and codes to be identified

The delivery of the results by the end of December 2020. - Annual workplan 2019,2020, 2021 developed Status: Achieved
- 9 internal technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert Working Group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) on justice sector reform Status: Achieved
- 3 technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) with Development Partners on justice sector reform Status: Achieved
- Regulations approved depending on identified needs Status: In process The need for development of by-laws and regulations will be determined after the completion of monitoring activities.
- 4 monitoring activities conducted by Expert Working Group and coordination mechanisms Status: In process
- 1 database developed for GPO Training Center / Equipping the training center with videoconferencing equipment, for the possibility of conducting online trainings Status: Achieved
- 1 TOT for GPO training Center held
- 1 manual and/or guidelines developed on fair trial standards Status: Achieved 3 guidelines developed.
- At least 80% of prosecutors trained who state an increased understanding after the training, including on fair trial standards and due process of law Status: In process Due to the Covid-19 situation and after October 4 political instability, the Project has conducted online trainings only for 266 prosecutors (which corresponds to 32% of the total number of prosecutors in the country), including 38 women, on the new criminal legislation to promote stronger justice providers’ interactions during criminal justice proceedings in consistent with fair trial standards and the new adversarial principles of the reform across the criminal justice chain:
- 20%of observed trials conducted in compliance with novelties of criminal justice sector reform Status: In process A procurement process has been launched. This exercise is expected to start by mid-February 2021.
- prosecutors trained on new laws and codes to be identified Status: Achieved

 Annual workplan 2020 -2021 developed,  Justice Strategy document, including financial analysis developed,  10 internal technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert Working Group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) on justice sector reform,  3 technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) with Development Partners on justice sector reform,  Regulations approved depending on identified needs,  4 monitoring activities conducted by Expert Working Group and coordination mechanisms,  1 TOT for GPO training Center held,  1 manual and/or guidelines developed on fair trial standards,  At least 80% of prosecutors trained who state an increased understanding after the training, including on fair trial standards and due process of law,  25%of observed trials conducted in compliance with novelties of criminal justice sector reform,  prosecutors trained on new laws and codes to be identified.

The delivery of the results by the end of December 2021.  Annual workplan 2020 -2021 developed, Justice Strategy document, including financial analysis developed o Status: completed  10 internal technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert Working Group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) on justice sector reform o Status: completed By Presidential Decree No. 83 of March 31, 2021, the Expert Working Group on Monitoring Judicial and Legal Reform was abolished.  3 technical meetings held by national coordination mechanisms (Expert group, Judicial Coordination Council, etc.) with Development Partners on justice sector reform o Status: completed  Regulations approved (depending on identified needs)  4 monitoring activities conducted by Expert Working Group and coordination mechanisms, o Status: completed By Presidential Decree No. 83 of March 31, 2021, the Expert Working Group on Monitoring Judicial and Legal Reform was abolished.  25% of observed trials conducted in compliance with novelties of criminal justice sector reform. o Status: completed  1 TOT for GPO Training Center held o Status: completed  1 manual and/or guidelines developed on fair trial standards o Status: completed  At least 80% of prosecutors trained who state an increased understanding after the training, including on fair trial standards and due process of law o Status: completed  prosecutors trained on new laws and codes (to be identified) o Status: completed
The project is aimed to be completed at the beginning of 2022.
To be reported after project closure.
